key_points: The weapons crew on the 'Rust' movie set, led by head armorer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed, was described as inexperienced and careless.
A source reported instances of the crew mishandling weapons, such as leaning them against their bodies or playing with their cellphones.
Alec Baldwin accidentally shot and killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and wounded director Joel Souza on the set.
Images obtained by Fox News show Gutierrez-Reed and assistants handling weapons in an unprofessional manner.
Concerns were raised about the lack of professionalism and safety protocols on the set.
Gutierrez-Reed is the daughter of famed movie armorer Thell Reed, suggesting potential nepotism in her hiring.
Prior incidents reported on set included two accidental discharges and one special effects explosion.
Camera assistant Lane Luper cited safety concerns for why he walked off the set before the fatal shooting.
Insiders claimed Gutierrez-Reed was hired due to her low cost and familial connections.
Jason Bowles, attorney for Gutierrez-Reed, defended her, saying she was well trained and prioritized safety on set.
